text: In the experiment of Tim and Jan, it is observed that the darker the surface, the higher the temperature inside the container. This is because the dark colors are absorbed by the surface and the heat is transmitted to the air in the dog hut by convection and heated. Brighter colors, such as white, reflect light and heat, the surface remains cooler, as does the interior of the swinger.

Tim and Jan’s experiment has shown that the color of the paint has a great influence on the interior temperature. The slightest warming occurred with the colour white and should therefore be applied to the dog hut.  This will keep it warm inside, but not as strong as other colors.

White: The white paint color would reflect the maximum amount of light, thereby warming the cabin the least. In the experiment, white has a threshold. 11 degrees lower temperature shown than black, and approx. 3 degrees lower than light grey.
The darker the color, the warmer it becomes inside. It is recommended to use white color so that the dog does not get too hot.
With strong sun exposure, the dog hut with a white roof would heat up less strongly than with a black, dark grey, light grey roof.
White: White is best, so that the dog hut does not heat too much.
Black: The darker the paint color, the higher the temperatures inside the painted object. Whereas the specific arrangement of the passage has only a small effect on the temperature.
The dog hut may heat up so heavily in summer that it is dangerous for the dog. Desalb should be taken a bright color to allow the dog a pleasant temperature

White :: With black paint, the cottage is heated most by sunlight, which is uncomfortable for the dog, possibly. It could even become dangerous. With white paint, the temperature in the cottage increases least.
I would choose the lighter color so it doesn’t get so hot as the experiment says that the dark colors absorb more energy

The perception of colors arises from the reflection/absorption of certain proportions of visible light, where black means relatively low reflection and white means relatively high reflection. The absorption of light also affects the temperature, so black objects in the sun would have to heat up faster than white ones. Tim and Jan’s experiment supports this thesis.
White: Darker colour stores more heat, absorbs, and continues to heat up.  The brightest color (white) makes the most sense since the temperature is the lowest/nearest to the original temperature.

dark grey :: As for the different colors that have absorbed the most heat, I think the main consideration might be how dark those colors were. I would think blue and purple’t take up so much; unless they were very dark blue and purple. Here is a spectral analysis of heat bulbs: http://heelspurs.com/a/led/black3.gif which shows how you can expect heat bulbs to emit the most energy in colors to the red end of the spectrum than expected. That would explain orange – did you try red too? Why did the coloured liquids absorb more heat than the paper-coated ones? I hope other experts can help, but consider how heat absorption works. With the paper, part of the heat is exposed, and the paper absorbs the energy, transfers it to the glass (and may also have some air between the two), which then transfers it to the water. In the colored waterfall, heat absorption occurs directly in the water, which should be more efficient. Did you have a control without coloring? How much has it warmed?
The darker the color, the higher the temperature in the hut, the worse for the dog (at least in summer).

In the meantime, Tim and Jan's experiment demonstrates that for greater clarity lower temperature, if the dog hut is for a warm place, he/she would paint it in white, and if it is for a cold place, he/she would paint it in black.
White: The color of the paint affects the interior temperature. Black is suitable for winter, white for summer.
light grey :: - the temperature remains the same, is more pleasant for the dog
White :: The greater the darkness of the color, the greater the degree of heat absorption is based on the results for black 54 52 54 53
For the house of dogs, a lamp is not necessary, as it makes the temperature very high
